title: Understanding Withdrawal
text: Withdrawal is a natural response to grief. It involves pulling away from social interactions and focusing inwardly. This can be a part of the healing process.

title: Social Networks and Grief
text: After a loss, social networks may change, leading to feelings of alienation. This is different from withdrawal, which is more about internal processing.

title: Empathy and Repeated Loss
text: Repeated exposure to loss can affect one's capacity for empathy, but this is not the same as withdrawal, which is a more immediate response to grief.

hintAnswer: a common, not necessarily unhealthy, side effect of grief, marked by a sense of pulling away from others and the world, a deep internalization of the grieving process

text: Which of the following best describes withdrawal in the context of grief?
